featured.text: They are sent to a wide variety of service-based businesses, including stores, restaurants, and banks—potentially anywhere customers are served.
They usually would not leave people’s houses until they were sure their customers were awake.
But do the customers really like them?

With a DJ playing various kinds of music rather than just rap, and a mix of clothing labels designed more for taste and fashion than for a precise age, department stores have managed to appeal to successful middle-aged women 20 losing their younger customers.
The bank tries its best to attract more customers.

other.text: They may also pretend to be 14 customers, arguing with a salesperson without a good reason.
Every morning, these people, often older in age, were seen in big streets and small alleys, waking up their customers professionally.
Sometimes referred to as secret shoppers, mystery shoppers 11 regular customers to purchase items, eat in restaurants, make inquiries, or return items.
17 sticks or pea shooters, the human alarms would tour the streets, tap on windows, or blast them with dried peas, trying to wake paying customers in time for work.

definition.zh_def: 顧客，指購買商品或服務的人。
definition.en_def: A person or organization that purchases goods or services from a business.
definition.example: The customer was satisfied with the service provided.
